text:
Restaurant famialle,
Un des meilleurs restaurant en terme de saveur.

Absolutely the worst Chinese food I have ever eaten. I just wasted 30$ of hard earned money. They also made a big mistake with my order. I ordered 2 of the combos that are supposed to come with wonton soup and rice. They delivered the principal plates instead which were more expensive and I did not get any rice or soup and when I called to let them know they refused to fix it. The Beef broccoli had a strange smell to it and the beef was grey. The poulet ananas looked like it was deep fried 2 days ago and then just reheated and it had a very small amount of sauce and burnt pinapple chunks.    Would not recommend.

Que dire de l'endroit... c'est une des expériences pas nécessairement mauvaises mais certainement pas mémorable. Le nom "Dragon Magnifique" est inspirant mais la cuisine ne se mesure pas au nom.

Étrangement, la clientèle semble en grande partie latino-américaine et ce restaurant qui se veut asiatique semble offrir une cuisine hybride composée de plats asiatiques et d'Amérique latine (sans qu'on parle de cuisine fusion tendance cependant).

Le tout est acceptable, mais j'aurais dû choisir un autre endroit après tout.

No reason this place should get only bad reviews. It's not the most elegant of restaurants but it's clean, food is good and portions are very generous. In Quebec most people are used to Chinese buffet style food. Le Dragon Manifique is definitely not in this style. It's roots come from Peru South America (hence the largely Latino clientele) There is an extremely large and established Chinese community in Peru. The best Chinese food I have ever eaten was in Peru. So leave your preconceptions about what Chinese food in Quebec is usually like and give them a try.

Serieusement c'est l'un des meilleurs restaurants chinois a Montreal, je ne comprend vraiment pas pourquoi ce restaurants a de mauvais review, ma famille y retourne constament et mes amis aussi. Le riz frit, chow mein cantonais et general tao sont excellent. Oui la place n'est pas la plus fancy mais c'est jolie et très propre. Leur style est unique ils ajoutent une touche d'amerique latine a leur cuisine puisqu'il ont passer une grande parti de leur vie en amerique du sud mais ils gardent toute meme leurs origines asiatique. Je recommende grandement ce restaurant. Je rajouterais des photos la prochaine fois que jy passerais.

Best chifa (Peruvian-Chinese food) I've had so far in Montreal! It caters to a very specific audience and you have to know what to order, because your usual knowledge of Chinese food in Quebec may not help you!
